Posts.Title: My Intro and a Query NewReality NewReality

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 09:04AM Kezzie62 wrote: I have just had a BMX without recon on March 18th,  I was able to drive and return to work as soon as my drains were removed (about 12 days), I have to drive myself into work everyday and I found it to be ok.. I have only just found out I am stage IV and I have just had all my scans done, I am just waiting for a treatment plan to be sorted out.  I have been given lots of options from all my doctors and I just need to look at them all and see what I think is the best for me. I was very angry that I had lost both my breasts for what I saw as no reason, (I am going to die anyway) but now I see that if having them removed will give me time then I am glad they have gone.  I has to be a choice you are happy with. Hugs. Kezzie

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2011 06:44AM Kezzie62 wrote: I agree that barbe1958 was trying to help Flower,  I wanted to point out that we do not always stop and think about how our posts come over to others.  I never sugested that we should be giving info about treatments, outcomes, options or anything else.  Its all very well being frank with people so that they get the correct information.  Most people when they first come to this forum do so in search of some comfort and support,  the information comes  after that. Frankness can be a bitter pill to swallow..... wrap in in some sugar and it goes down easy.. Just a thought... Kezzie
Posts.Title: could this be the case flowerfloosey barbe1958

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 05:15AM Kezzie62 wrote: Flower, sorry you did not get the full results you were hoping for.. I am sure you will feel much more comfortable with the end result knowing that they have checked everything so carefully.  Good Luck for the excisional next week.  Keep us posted. Kezzie
Posts.Title: could this be the case flowerfloosey barbe1958

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2011 05:16AM Kezzie62 wrote: She is angry with you barbe1958 because your post comes over as you telling her she is over reacting and needs to calm down, you dismissed her fears because you feel she will need that energy later down the road if she is DX..  I know that I was blown away when my journey started, all I could think about was my own death... You only know that the panic and fear are better channeled once DX has been made, because you have already moved on from the 1st steps of this journey..  Try to remember that at the beginning this IS the worst thing that has happened in most peoples lives.. I just remember how fragile I was feeling at that time.. Kezzie
Posts.Title: could this be the case flowerfloosey barbe1958

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2011 07:37AM Kezzie62 wrote: My Cancer DX was not wrapped in sugar either... Yes she may have been wrong to get angry in her PM's that is between you and her. I wanted to point out that what you type and what someone reads may not come over the same way.  No one is suggesting you stand around and watch her flailing. The DX of cancer can not be sugar coated but the way we offer information and support can be. I am sorry if my post has got you "mad" maybe we all have issues about hearing things that we might not want to hear, especially when we are feeling very fragile.... Just a thought..

Posts.Content: Kezzie62 wrote: Hi All Well I had my appointment with my breast surgeon this afternoon and I have opted for a PBM.  I talked it over with her and given the strong family history and the DX of ADH in left and LCIS/ADH in the right breast the risk for me is very high.  I am planning to have my surgery in March 2011, the risk of heavy snow or ice will be past by then. So if anyone has any advice or info that will help me plan for this I would be grateful.  I have decided not to have any reconstruction so if anyone can help with info about bras and prosthetic boobs that would be great. You are all such a wonderful group of ladies and I look forward to any help you can offer me. Thanks Kezzie 03/10 ADH, 09/10 DCIS, 02/11 IDC Stage IIa, Grade 3 03/18/11 BMX + SNB, 05/12/11 Stage IV Bone & Brain Mets. Dx 2/23/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/22 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Prophylactic Bilateral Mastectomy Kezzie62 fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2010 11:09AM Kezzie62 wrote: I too had a DX of ADH after core bx,  My BS suggested a wide excisional biopsy and like you it showed ADH with positive margins too. I went with the watch and wait that my BS recommended.  Six months later I went for my 1st MRI and it showed two very suspicious areas, and so another set of biopsies was done, this time they came back  as ADH & DCIS in my left and LCIS in my right breast.  I can not live with the high risk and I can not take Tamoxifen due to history of DVT so I am scheduled to have a bilateral mastectomy done on March 18th..  You need to do what is right for you, if your second opinion is saying do more surgery and that is what you feel is right for you then go with that doctor... remember the doctors work for you, you can change them whenever you want.  You do not have to go with their recommendation.. I cant comment on how effective taking iodine would be but I would not be taking the chance..  Good Luck Kezzie

Posts.Title: results are in and they are B9 YEAH ScariedCat VSM

Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 09:59AM Kezzie62 wrote: ebann, I did not want reconstruction. I have always been very large busted I was a DDD so the thought of not have breasts was like a dream come true.  I have had neck and shoulder issues for many years from the weight so I am enjoying the fact that I have lost 9lbs of breasts.  I can be any size I want and I can be as flat as I want.  There are times when I miss my breasts and I now have a larger tummy, well it looks larger because I can now see it... so It is giving me a good incentive to loose some weight.  I am still having days where I an in the depth of despair and wish I had kept my breasts but then in my better moments I am glad they and the tumor has gone.  I am just hoping that the better moments will become more and more.  Maybe once I have some hair and some toe nails I will feel a bit happier but for now I have all of you wonderful ladies to guide me on the new path.. Kezzie
Posts.Title: Feeling Pleased with myself Kezzie62 EnglishMajor

Posts.Content: Kezzie62 wrote: I am feeling very pleased with myself today... I have made my first pair of Microbead breast forms..  I used my silicone ones as a template and then cut and sewed some streachy material and the filled it with microbeads.. now they are wild little things they get everywhere, they stick to everything.  The Breast forms look good and will be so much cooler and lighter for the summer. Kezzie 03/10 ADH, 09/10 DCIS, 02/11 IDC Stage IIa, Grade 3 03/18/11 BMX + SNB, 05/12/11 Stage IV Bone & Brain Mets. Dx 2/23/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/22 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feeling Pleased with myself Kezzie62 EnglishMajor

Posts.Content: May 29, 2011 10:56AM Kezzie62 wrote: sharalou, you can use them in a swimsuit as long as it has pockets.  The microbeads do not absorb water and they will float so it must be secure inside a pocket or it will float out... (cound be funny) I have used simsuit material for the front of the form and cotton for the back.  They dry very fast as they dont hold water. I tried drying them with a hair dryer on cool this morning after soaking them in the sink and just a quick squeeze in my hand, it took only 7 minutes for them to be totaly dry. Kezzie
Posts.Title: Feeling Pleased with myself Kezzie62 EnglishMajor

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2011 09:57PM Kezzie62 wrote: Thank you all so much for the good wishes.  I started my new chemo last tuesday, was a bit hard on the old body took until thursday until I was able to get out of bed.  I am happy to report that I have been able to cut back on my pain meds so my brain fog is much better.  I am sad that I am going to loose the 1/4 inch of hair that I have been willing to grow for the last few months.. but I guess that is a small price to pay..  I was suprised that my treatment took 5 hours so many bags on the IV, some for steroids one for anti-sickness and 3 for fluids and of course the magic medicine... Hope everyone is good.. Hugs to all Kezzie

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 10:45AM Kezzie62 wrote: Hi Feb Ladies,  I am from the March11 group but I wanted to share some info with you all.  I read on this site about Post Surgical Camisols and thought they sounded just right for me.  I talked it over with my BS and she gave me a prescription for 2 of them.  I took that to the Friends shop in Dana Farber here in boston (most cancer centers/hospitals will have one) and they ordered me the camisols and the best news of all is that my insurance covers the cost.. Good luck and speedy recovery to all. Kezzie

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 02:35PM Kezzie62 wrote: My BS gave me a prescription for 2 Post Surgical Camisoles and I went to get them from the 'Friends Place" at Dana Farber CI.  The wonderful ladies there gave me a goodie bag with a small pillow, a front opening mastectomy bra a pair of puffy foobs, some scar cream and the 2 camisoles all in a lovely tote bag that I can use for my things when I go for surgery. The days are slipping by so what are others doing to get ready for their surgery? Hugs Kezzie

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2011 12:04PM - edited Feb 24, 2011 12:05PM by Kezzie62 She might not be able to get copies of the pathology reports.. I know in the UK they do not give you copies of your reports, you would need to apply to your area health board and request access to your records and then you would be able to have a copy of the report but all that would take months to get.  I am not sure how open they are in Russia with medical records. Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2011 08:00PM Kezzie62 wrote: Hi All I am now 4 weeks from surgery, BMX no recon.  I went away for a 5 day cruise with my husband to give me some chill time before I return to work next week.  got back last night and had an appointment to get fitted for my prosthetics and bra's. I used to be a 42 DD but I have decided to be a 42 B+ my fitter was very helpful and took time to explain everything to me, I took my Mom with me so she could tell me what she thought obout how things looked as I tried on diffrent bras and prosthetics.  I left wearing my new prosthetics and a lovely lacy bra and carrying the 4 other bras I had picked. My range of motion is almost back to normal in both arms, my scar on the left side has totally healed and all the scabs have fallen off but on my right side the wound still weeps in two spots that are taking longer to heal.  I am hoping it will be healed soon.  I found that doing my exercises in the shower help me with getting everything moving again. My skin all around my chest area is hyper sensitive and I dont know how long that will last but I am very lucky that I have had no pain since the day of surgery. I hope all of you still dealing with pain find relief soon.

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2011 05:27PM Kezzie62 wrote: I used to live in the UK and the hospital care there is very diffrent from what we get here.. I had some surgery done in the UK and there you are admitted to hospital the day before your surgery, the hospital I was in had bays of 6 beds.  It was not possible to have family stay with you, they were only allowed to visit at set times.  I had a drain in my hip and I was not allowed to go home until the drain had been removed.  I had physical therapy every day and I saw the doctor everyday.  I was in hospital for 10 days. I have a friend who has had a mastectomy done in the UK and she was in hospital for 14 days, She has never heard of anyone going home the nextday.. We may have the best medicine here but I dont think we have the best care..

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 10:15AM Kezzie62 wrote: Hi Just checking in...   Had my surgery March 18th, no recon, and I am doing very well.  I am back at work (have been for 2 weeks) and I am doing all my normal activities.  I have been fitted for my prothetics and mastectomy bras and I am getting used to having them, If I did not have such a big belly (well it looks big to me) then I might go totaly flat as I feel so much better without the silicon boobs, but I need to look my best for work, so every morning I have to put on my NEW girls and deal with them all day. Hope everyone is doing good. Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: May 23, 2011 06:55PM Kezzie62 wrote: I was told after my BMX that I was not allowed to swim for 8 weeks or until all wounds had fully heeled.  Kezzie
Posts.Title: How long after PBMX, no recon. can we swim in a swimming pool? iammommy SoCalLisa

Posts.Content: Kezzie62 wrote: Hi All, I need your thoughts on my situation..  I have a DX of ADH in my left breast and ADH/LCIS in my right breast.  I have had a lumpectomy on my left breast in march 2010 and a wire guided biopsy on my right breast in Aug 2010. I was tested for BRACS I & II both are neg. but I do have a very strong family history on my fathers side, I can not take Tamoxifen or the other drug as I have a history of DVT (clots).  I have just had tests done to find out if I am menopausal as I had a hystorectomy years ago.  Results show a FHS of 97 IU/L and a Estradoil of <35 and my Onc says that I am menopausal. They are telling me that my risk over the next 5 years is 52% and higher over the next 15 years.  I have an appointment to see a breast surgeon next week as they would like me to consider a bilatral masectomy. Is there anyone out there that is in the same situation as me???  Do people have surgery when they dont yet have cancer??  03/10 ADH, 09/10 DCIS, 02/11 IDC Stage IIa, Grade 3 03/18/11 BMX + SNB, 05/12/11 Stage IV Bone & Brain Mets. Dx 2/23/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/22 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2011 04:55PM Kezzie62 wrote: Ok so I called today to find out what time I am to report for my surgery in the morning.... wow I have to be there for 6am.  Its going to be an early start for us tomorrow.  I took my sleeping pill last night so I did get some sleep and I feel better for that.  I went to the Y and did an hour of excersize today and then had my hair cut.  I think I am going to have an early night and take the other sleeping pill. Thank you all for your ongoing support.  I will be home on Sunday and hope to tell you all how it went. Hugs.. Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2011 05:20AM Kezzie62 wrote: Just about to leave for the hospital..... Pray for me. Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2011 03:00PM Kezzie62 wrote: Hi all, I made it.... I am just home from the hospital, they let me go a day early. I can not believe how little pain I have. I have only taken tylenol since surgery. I have had a look at my chest and although a bit bruised looks not too bad. I have four drains but they are not bothering me for now. I ended up having 22 nodes removed as the SNB had some cancer cells. I won't know the full results until next week at my followup. The nurses showed my husband how to care for the drains and the visiting nurse will be coming in everyday for the next week. Well I am glad to be home but I am off to have some sleep. (((((((hugs)))))))) Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2011 09:17PM Kezzie62 wrote: Wow there are so many this week... Best wishes to all having surgery this coming week... You will be home and recovering before you know it. I will keep you in my prayers. Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 06:58PM Kezzie62 wrote: I was hoping to get 2 of my drains out, but sad to say I have to wait until friday.  My BS thinks I can get them all out on friday so I am holding out for that.  They feel very tight and "nip" when I move. brca1953, glad to here you are doing ok. and very happy to hear it did not hurt too much getting the drains out. agnieszka, Welcome home... good to hear things went well.  I know what you mean about being restless, I am the same.  I am not allowed to shower until the drains are out so I am sure glad you cant smell over the internet.  A quick wash at the sink is just not the same. I have been told my final pathology will be available tomorrow and that my BS will call me to discuss the results and what our next steps are.... Gental Hugs to all.... Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2011 05:06PM Kezzie62 wrote: Just got the call from my BS with my final pathology.. IDC, 2cm, Stage IIa, Grade 2, 4/22 nodes, ER+ just PR-, HER2-. no vascular involvment. She said the sentinal nodes had microinvasion that is why she went on to remove 18 more but all other were negative.  I have appointment with Onc for 03/31/11 but I may not need chemo as I am post menapausal and risk of mets is low... I am happy with the results and hope I dont have to have chemo..
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2011 05:28PM Kezzie62 wrote: Welcome home JeanneR, Good to hear you are doing ok... use the pain killers for as long as you need them, there is no point in being in pain.  Congrats on the neg nodes, positive thoughts for your final pathology. Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2011 05:11PM Kezzie62 wrote: I am sending good wishes and speedy recoveries to all our March ladies having surgery this week. I am now 9 days post BMX and I am healing well. I am sleeping better now that the drains are out, can't lie on my side for long as the scar from my node removal start to ache. I went out for lunch with my parents yesterday, I was so tired when I got home. I must say the only thing I struggle with is that now my chest is totally flat my belly looks about 7 months pregnant. Think I am going to have to try loose some of the belly. I may get some sort of tummy control garment to see if it make me look less pregnant. I have some of the feeling coming back in my armpit but I feel like there is a huge lump of something under my arm but when I feel it with my hand it is just my armpit... Most odd. Keep well everyone. Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2011 02:39PM Kezzie62 wrote: hope everyone is doing well....
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: May 14, 2011 05:21PM Kezzie62 wrote: Hi all my fellow March 2011 sisters, I wanted to give you an update, I Have been healing very well and other than starting chemo I thought all was welluntil I started having pain in my ribs.  To cut a long story short they have found out I have mets to my bones and brain.  So I am now classed as being stage IV.  I am still trying to come to terms with all of this but I wanted to share this with the people I know will understand how I am feeling. Hugs to you all, Kezzie
Posts.Title: March 2011 Mastectomy elmcity69 Glo3mom

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2011 10:03AM Kezzie62 wrote: I had a BMX because I did not want the worry, or risk involved with my other breast.  As it turns out It was needed because of a undiscovered tumor.  I cant imagine only having one removed I think I would have hated that more than having both done.  I an now trying my 2nd week of going flat at work and I am liking it very much. I dont think the "fat shelf" has anything to do with size or age, I too was a 38 DD when I was 14 and I am almost 50 but I dont have this shelf.  I think it is just that we are all made differently so some may have it and others wont.  Kezzie
Posts.Title: No reconstruction- Happy w/your decision? marlee1 quietpools

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2011 10:31AM Kezzie62 wrote: Barbe, Thanks for the explanation, I am sorry you are having to deal with this ridge and the issue with your ribs.  Maybe I am just lucky as I dont even have a ridge. Is there nothing the PS can do to remove the ridge so that it is better for you? Kezzie
Posts.Title: No reconstruction- Happy w/your decision? marlee1 quietpools

Posts.Content: Kezzie62 wrote: Hi Ladies,  I am nine weeks out from my BMX and I have been wearing silicon forms and they have been ok.  I want to wear microbead forms in the summer as I think the silicone ones will be too hot and heavy.  My problem is that I have some loose skin under my arms(size 20 on the top before surgery) and when I try the microbead form in my bras it looks odd because there is the form and then a gap and then this bulge of skin.  The bras I am using as soft sided and I am wondering if gettin a bra with more support at the side would work better.  Has anyone had this issue? If so how did you get round it. 03/10 ADH, 09/10 DCIS, 02/11 IDC Stage IIa, Grade 3 03/18/11 BMX + SNB, 05/12/11 Stage IV Bone & Brain Mets. Posts.Content: May 19, 2011 02:05PM Kezzie62 wrote: Margi, What a wonderful daughter you are.  I am sure your Mom know how blessed she is to have you looking after her.  I too have 4 generation in my family.  I hope your Mom remains comfortable and pain free. Kezzie
Posts.Title: My Mum's story Margi1959 Margi1959

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2011 06:09PM Kezzie62 wrote: I had BMX on March 18th and I had no pain at all.  I did not take anything other than a Tylanol for a headache from the anisthetic.  I did not have reconstruction and I have not lost any of my range of motion in fact it is better than it was because I no longer have 42DD in the way.  I was able to drive very soon after and was back at work within a few weeks, I could have one back sooner but they did not want me at work with the drain in, so I had to stay out until they were removed.  I have had more discomfort having the biopsy done than the BMX. Kezzie
Posts.Title: how painful mastectomy is and how do you cope up with it? h0petoBC Fearless_One

Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 01:04PM Kezzie62 wrote: Fearless_one, you can get approved for SSDI at stage IV, and you can get accelerated benefits if you have less than 12 months.  The only way for you to find out about your own situation is to go to SSA and talk to them.  They will be able to give you the answers you need for your situation.  What applies to one person here does not mean it applies to all. Kezzie
Posts.Title: Stage 3 and social security disability benefits bak94 pupfoster1

Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 09:29AM Kezzie62 wrote: Hi all, I was able to have a good chat with my Mom last night, I pushed her into telling me why she thinks I don't care about them. She got very upset and said that it not right for a child to die before a parent and she want to spend every minute she can with me. I explained to her that people can live for a long tome with stage IV and that I don't think I am ready to die anytime soon. I explained why I want to continue to work but she can't see that all of the family treat me differently now, she thinks I am trying to hide the truth about my situation. I was able to show her the posts on here and she was able to see that maybe just maybe she had selfish reasons for wanting me to stay home. I just gotta love my Mom, she is stronger than I will ever be. Thank you all for your thoughts on this, it has helped me focus on what's real and not stick my head in the sands or cruise on the river of de-Nile.. Hugs Kezzie
Posts.Title: Feel like I am backed into a corner Kezzie62 Fitztwins

Posts.Content: Kezzie62 wrote: I am so confused right now.. I thought I was getting a handle on all of this but now I dont think I am..  I think I understand my treatment plan.  I am to finish my chemo, 2 more to go and then I am to have Femara & Zometa to help with the bone mets.  If I want I can try some radiation to the mets in my hip and rib that are causing a lot of pain. Once my chemo is done I am to have a brain MRI to see if the mets there have gone or are smaller.  It will depend on the result if I am to have treatment for that too. I work full time as my husband is disabled and the mortgage needs to be paid.  The family are giving me a hard time because I want to continue to work as much as I can, my employer is happy to accommodate me and is offering any help I need.  The family feel I should stop work and claim any help from Social Security.  I have said I do not want to do that right now, I would rather carry on working the best I can.  They have said I am being selfish and I am not thinking about my family... WTF they don't have cancer I do.  I am so angry at them.  Am I wrong to feel like this?  Should I just give up my life and be the sick person they want me to be?  What about my needs in all of this? Work is my escape to being normal for a few hours a day.  Is that so wrong? Kezzie 03/10 ADH, 09/10 DCIS, 02/11 IDC Stage IIa, Grade 3 03/18/11 BMX + SNB, 05/12/11 Stage IV Bone & Brain Mets. Dx 2/23/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/22 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2011 02:13PM Kezzie62 wrote: I am to have the radioactive injection once I am in the OR, my surgeon will then use a handheld wand to detect the nodes she wants to remove.  I am happy that I dont have to worry about the shot hurting as I will be asleep by then.. Kezzie
Posts.Title: Question about timing of injection for SNB GabbyCal GabbyCal

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2011 02:18PM Kezzie62 wrote: I was a 42 DD and I have not had any recon. My BS did my BMX and I have never been seen by a PS so no lipo or anything else.  Breast surgeon only removed breast tissue so I need some revision for exess skin under my arms but no ridge or shelf.  Kezzie
Posts.Title: No reconstruction- Happy w/your decision? marlee1 quietpools

Posts.Content: May 28, 2011 01:01PM Kezzie62 wrote: Fearless_One you statement about earning under 1K for the 6months before you apply is not correct.  My Nice was in a very well paid job earning just over 3k a month. She was hit by a teen driver who was texting while driving and has been left unable to walk or do much for herself.  She applied for SSDI 2 months after her accident and while she was on STD from her job.  She was approved within 3 months and has just started getting her payments last month. She has to wait 24 months from her approval date to get Medicare and she has been told that if she does anywork that has income of more than 1k a month she has to notify SSA.  They never asked about how much she was earning prior to her acident or how much she was getting in STD/LTD. I would advise anyone who is thinking of applying for SSDI to check out there situation with the SSA before you apply.  There are also loads of lawyers who will help you get SSDI and they charge a % of any back dated money you get. Kezzie
Posts.Title: Stage 3 and social security disability benefits bak94 pupfoster1

Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 12:49PM Kezzie62 wrote: You can go on short term disability if your employer provides that and then when that runs out you can get long term disability.  You can get this while you are waiting for your SSDI claim to be approved.  My Employer has STD that pays full pay for 12 weeks then LTD that pays 60% of full pay.  If you are awarded SSDI they will deduct any amount you have been paid from your STD/LTD from any arrears of SSDI.  You can continue to get your LTD but your SSDI will be reduced by the same amount. For stage IV you can get accelerated benefits if your doctor will confirm that you are not expected to live for more than 12 month.
Posts.Title: Stage 3 and social security disability benefits bak94 pupfoster1

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2011 05:54PM Kezzie62 wrote: Turtletots, Thanks for posting the link to your blog.  I have had a BMX and no recon, I have been thinking about some scar revision as like you I have a bit of excess skin under each arm and little pointed bits on the inside end of both scars.  Being able to see the wonderful result you have been able to get with your scar revison I am going to talk to my BS about a referal to a PS to see what they can do for me.  At the moment I have no fat under the skin where my breasts were so it looks a bit sunken but I am hoping that will get better with time or maybe the PS can do something for that too. Thank you again for posting your photo's

Posts.Title: Feel like I am backed into a corner Kezzie62 Fitztwins

Posts.Content: May 20, 2011 02:17PM Kezzie62 wrote: You ladies are wonderful... I was beginning to think maybe I was being silly planning to continue to work.  My husband does not need any care from them, he is able to do most things in the house but he is not able to work full time at a job, he is autistic.  The reason they (my parents live with us, but my grown children are in Scotland) dont want me to work is because "people who are dying dont go out to work" I have explained to them that I need to keep something normal in my life as it will help me deal with all of this. I have also told them that we are all dying we just dont know when.  I plan on being around for many years yet.  They feel I am not facing reality and I should be spending all the time I have left with them and not with strangers at work.  They think I dont care about them... It just adds to my sadness. Kezzie
Posts.Title: Feel like I am backed into a corner Kezzie62 Fitztwins
